Your work is appreciated SecTPB. These 60fps files never work great streaming from PC to PS3 with PS3 Media Server, I usually wait for the lower quality ones. Do you by chance recommend anything that plays these files smooth, streaming from PC to a PS3?

@_Neurotix_
Yup, everything except PPV, which costs money I don't have, otherwise that'd be here too. Enjoy, and thanks.

@toothizmz
I would not suggest streaming at all. I'd suggest using your PC/Laptop monitor or connect your PC/Laptop to your TV via HDMI or S-Video, depending on your PC/Laptop graphics card's output ports. 

You can also try using a USB flash drive. I hear changing the file extension to .mpg or .mpeg allows the PS3 and 360 to read the files, but I've never verified it personally. But direct-play of the file is your best option. 

Streaming transcodes the files into a legible video and audio format, reducing quality anyway. I doubt you'd get the full 60FPS as your network will most likely struggle to buffer the data during playback.

Thanks SecTPB

Also @toothizmz are you streaming to the PS3 through wireless? because I use the PS3 media server through the NIC and there's no problem streaming the 720p files.
